The claim was made by Ashley Smith: a transgender individual, who posted a comment on her Facebook page during Governor Abbott's re-election rally.
Smith referred to a report from the Will: a UCLA School of Law think tank, which estimated that 0.6 percent of U.S. adults identify as transgender.
The Williams Institute report stated tha: suggesting that approximately 1.4 million adults in the U.S. identify as transgender.
By applying the institute: s estimate to the U.S. Census Bureau's population data, it was calculated that approximately 1.8 in every 300 U.S. adults identify as transgender.
